titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Spiller H. Dickinson, G. R. Thompson, and William Glass, Indictment
CWG10916

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment
Spiller H Dickinson G R Thompson and William Glass

The Grand Jury of Todd County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky; accused Spiller H Dickinson G R Thompson and William Glass of the offense of gaming Committed as follows, viz; The said Spiller, H Dickinson G R Thompson and William Glass did on the 30" day of September 1860 in the County aforsaid bet wager win and loose money property and witness things of value at a game of chance played with cards by and between Said Spiller H Dickinson G R Thompson and William Glass in the County aforsaid aginst the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

U E Kennedy
foreman of the Grand Jury

Information given by
Lycurgus Leavell
Chas L Billingsly

E P Campbell atty
for the Commonwealth

Commonwealth
V } Indictment for Gaming
S H Dickinson G R Thompson
A True Bill
U E Kennedy
Foreman of the
Grand Jury
Filed October 19th 1861
